items.title: Master of Art / Thesis
items.description: Three models of memory in their context of media–historical development

intro.title: Master of Art / Thesis
intro.description: Three models of memory in their context of media–historical development.

captions.content: Beginning with the natural processes of human memories, the thesis analyses the cultural development to the contemporary information age.

The first model was developed in the Renaissance and was specified as an theatre of memory. The analog model is the precursor for nowadays structures of interactive user-experiences, because it is based on strong topographical and visual methods.

The digital »Spatial-Data-Management-System« is the second memory model. It was developed in the Sixties by a team of scientests at Massachusetts Institute of Technology and presents the first steps of the computer technology.
The layout of the thesis presents also a topographical approach, while references and pictorial material are set according to the content of the main text.

items.title: Master of Art / Project
items.description: Carnival of the animals – A digital music book for children

intro.title: Master of Art / Project
intro.description: Carnival of the animals – A digital music book for children

captions.content: The digital music book is inspired by Camille Saint-Saëns purely instrumental composition of »Carnival of the animals«. The music describes little humoristc tales with a variety of musical stylistics. The animations are created in AfterEffects.

The starting point of the application presents the original constellation of the chamber orchestra from »Carnival of the animals«. By tapping on the different musical items, the child has the possibility to receive a first impression of the instrumental sound. The whole visual concept of the music book is based on the constellation of instruments.
The illustrations of each music piece are dynamically constructed by the items of the chamber orchestra. Further on the coloured items elucidates the active instruments in each music piece.

During the discovery of music and animation, the child also has the opportunity to receive further information, by tapping on the coloured instruments. All information is set with the dynamical antiqua “Adobe Caslon Pro”.

Every music piece is illustrated by the shapes and forms of the instruments. The aim was to preserve an imaginative approach to classical music. The multimedia mixture of poetic music, abstract animation and fictional text enables an engaging learning experience.
The high sharp sounds of the violins imitate the screeching and squawking in a chicken pen.

items.title: Poster Series
items.description: Probational lectures at the University of Bielefeld

intro.title: Poster Series
intro.description: Probational lectures at the University of Bielefeld.

captions.content: A selection of applicants for the professorship in “Illustration and Graphic Design” had to present their didactical skills by presenting their own work in a probational lecture. Afterwards the students had the opportunity to evaluate the work and teaching of each candidate.

The illustrations for the poster are adapted from a sports book for indian club training. The intention was to create an ironical approach to the expecta- tions, how a qualified person for the professorship in Illustration needs to be.

items.title: Book Design
items.description: The story “Alices Adventures in Wonderland” written by Lewis Carrol

intro.title: Poster Series
intro.description: The story “Alices Adventures in Wonderland” written by Lewis Carrol

captions.content: The front cover shows one of the most significant characters of Lewis Carroll’s tale: the white rabbit with the pocket-watch, who leads Alice to the magical Wonderland. As he accompanies her through out her crazy adventure, they encounter the many colourful characters as they go.

The aim was to develop a new modern look for the historical and famous story Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland. Vibrant colours and sparkling forms represent the crazy and miraculous world of Alice’s bizzare dream. The visual concept of the cover can be also find in the inside of the book. The simple black and white icons provide further visual clues for each chapter.

The tragedy of King Oedipus is staged in a book with subjective  typographical treatment. Phrase by phrase and word by word King Oedipus develops towards his doom, typographical drawn by the merciless fall into the book bind.

items.title: Digital Atlas
items.description: Wonderworld Calendar – A digital Atlas for children

intro.title: Digital Atlas
intro.description: Wonderworld Calendar – A digital Atlas for children

captions.content: The digital atlas teaches the cartographic and cultural contents with a highly dynamic and visual method. The idea is based on the phenomenon of “cabinets of wonder” from the 16th and 17th century. At this time European discoverers collected during their expeditions various exotic objects and on the turn to Europe replaced the found pieces to a universal collection.

The picture presents an example of the “WonderWorldCalendar” during winter time. By starting the app the child views a virtual cabinet of wonder, which is filled with the most wonderous objects from the whole world. The range of objects is determined by the seasonal structures of the vibrant world, because every item symbolizes a traditional event, whereby it represents the cultural incidences of a country.

The programming of the virtual cabinet is leaded by the calendric course of cultural celebrations. Depending on the contemporary appearence of the traditional events, the visibility of the itmes is limited in time. Therefore the child is daily confronted with new constellations of foreign objects and this diversity arouses the curiosity of the recipient.
The radical mixture of most diverse objects in one room created a spectacular view for the observer.

Every object refers the child to detailed information about the cultural event and a menu leads the child through the content. The different menu links provide information about the country, a cartographic material and a tablet of content.

The user also can navigate freely between the different virtual places: cabinet of wonder, archive and an interent-based collectors’ fair. Additionally the cartographic material represents the current location of celebration activities.
This is the first paragraph.
This is the second paragraph.

The brief involved creating an image that captures the theme of “resitance”. The visual solution uses the juxtaposition of conformity vs. non-conformity. The book ends are a metaphor for traditional boundaries, which can be broken and challanged by radical thinking.

The main theme for the book cover is the ambiguity of Jean-Baptiste Grenouille's gift. He is able to create the most beautiful perfume of the world, but his dream costs human blood and death. The ambiguity is visualised by a colourful field of flowers which hides the terrible truth:the shape of a dead woman's body.

items.title: Cartographical Scale
items.description: A map functions like a funnel, concentrating information into a smaller area depending on scale.

captions.content: A map functions like a funnel, concentrating information into a smaller manageable area depending on scale.

The piece contains three main elements; the map in a perforated format, a demonstrative scale to illustrate how much the information in question is condensed, and instructions detailing the assembly of the funnel.
The three different maps – the street map, the world map and the star chart – clearly shows these different scales.

The paper funnel is an informational design piece, demonstrating the function and purpose of map scale. A map functions like a funnel, concentrating information into a smaller, more managable area depending on scale.

items.title: Typographical Visualisation
items.description: Expression of the feelings of an old woman “I am still here”

intro.title: Typographical Visualisation
intro.description: Expression of the feelings of an old woman “I am still here”

captions.content: Fading Memories is a typographic project inspired by a conversation between an old woman and a young man at the bus station. The typography demonstrates the true feelings hidden behind her actual words, of an old and feeble woman neglected by the people. As such, she feels her social shortcomings and knows she is only a fading figure in our society.
